6/ The philosophy:

Ethereum = strict, irreversible penalties.

Cosmos = balanced with small penalties for downtime.

Polkadot = flexible, with community driven reversals.

5/ 🔍 Frequency matters:

Ethereum: Slashing appears in only ~0.003% of blocks.

Cosmos & Polkadot: <0.002% of blocks have slashing events.

Most incidents are caused by technical errors, not attacks.

4/ Polkadot:

Uses tiered slashing (0.01% to 100% of stake) depending on severity.

Slashed DOT goes to the Treasury, not burned.

Governance can reverse a slash in case of mistakes.
